definitions.definition: Situated toward or at the front of something.
examples: The fire was confined to the forward portion of the store.
the forward gun in a ship
the forward ship in a fleet

subdefinitions.definition: Situated toward or near the enemy lines.
examples: The forward battalion took a hammering.

definitions.definition: Acting in or pertaining to the direction in which someone or something is facing.
examples: My forward vision is fine, but my peripheral vision is poor.

definitions.definition: Acting in or pertaining to the direction of travel or movement.
examples: forward motion , forward thrust , forward momentum

definitions.definition: Moving in the desired direction of progress.
examples: This is an important forward step for the country.

definitions.definition: Having the usual order or sequence.
examples: The front of the fire engine has backward writing, that can be read in a mirror, as well as forward writing.

definitions.definition: Expected or scheduled to take place in the future.
examples: The stock price is currently 12 times forward earnings.
The price for forward delivery is presently higher than the spot price.

definitions.definition: Advanced beyond the usual degree; advanced for the season; precocious .
examples: These students are very forward in their learning.
The grass is forward , or forward for the season. We have a forward spring.

definitions.definition: Without customary restraint or modesty; bold , cheeky , pert , presumptuous or pushy .
examples: She is a very forward young lady, not afraid to speak her mind.

definitions.definition: Ready; prompt ; ardently inclined; in a bad sense, eager or hasty .

main_definition: ( not comparable ) Situated toward or at the front of something.
secondary_definitions: Acting in or pertaining to the direction in which someone or something is facing.
Acting in or pertaining to the direction of travel or movement.
( figuratively ) Moving in the desired direction of progress.
Having the usual order or sequence.
( finance , commerce ) Expected or scheduled to take place in the future.
Advanced beyond the usual degree; advanced for the season; precocious .
Without customary restraint or modesty; bold , cheeky , pert , presumptuous or pushy .
( obsolete ) Ready; prompt ; ardently inclined; in a bad sense, eager or hasty . [to 19th century]
